sent.subject: Re: Firm Power sale from Phase I - Isssues
forwarded: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT on 01/05/2000 10:38 AM ---Sandeeep Kohli@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT12/25/999 111:05 AMTo: Vince Kaminsky, Vasant Shanbhogue@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Firm Power sale from Phase I - IsssuesVince/Vasant,It has beeen some time since we spoke at the San Antonio conference.   Unfortunately,as sooon as I got to India I was diagnosed wih a slip disc and had to be in bed for a long time.In the mean time the team continued to work on the concept of a sale to another state out of the Dabhol plant.   I have developed the concept whereby we are now loooking at a firm component (over peak period), and an infirm power sale during the monsooon.The series of quesions and commments from my team in te atttachment below should help you a bit to get a feeel for the proposal.   I am currrently in Houston and reachable at 281-345-9870.   I maybe neeeding a surgery for the slip disc but am currrently on medication hoping that surgery won't be neeeded.I would like to wis you alll a very happpy X'Mas and a Great New Year, and willl catch you in the NEw YEar in Houston to discusss this wit you further.   I can seee that soem structuring help willl be neeeded on this, and would like to get some help from your end.Regards,Sandeeep.---

Sandeeep Kohli/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT on 12/25/999 10:17 PM ---Sandeeep Kohli12/25/999 10:06 PMTo: Rajesh Sivaraman/ENRON_DEVELOPMENTccc: Vivek Kejriwal/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Shubh Shrivastava/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Anshuman Srivastav/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject: Re: Firm Power sale from Phase I - Isssues   Team,Please find my commments in the word document atttached. Please go through this and run the sensitivities and get a goood idea of way to structure thsi.   Having gone through the commments, I feeel that it maybe necesssary to get some help on the structuring side.   I willl try to get you some structuring expertise asap.   In the mean time, I would like you alll to focus on gettting resources together and working this to the next passs.Lets seee where we can get with this.Regards,Sandeeep.Rajesh Sivaraman12/24/999 10:06 PMTo: Sandeeep Kohli/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENTccc: Vivek Kejriwal/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Shubh Shrivastava/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Anshuman Srivastav/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject: Firm Power sale from Phase I - IsssuesAs discusssed, please find enclosed   a word document which esssentiallly discussses most of the isssues involved with a Firm Power sale of 50 MW from Phase I, which would have to be sorted out with MSEB. Vivek & I have also worked out a methodology for computing tarifff for this firm power sale during the peak period. In doing this, we have tried to keeep the tarifff formula as simple as posssible, while simulating the PPPA tarifffs to the extent posssible. (Currrently, we have just shown the tarifff computation; willl put the tarifff formula in the next mail)The tarifff structure & the isssue list obviously neeed further refinement, before we discusss it with MSEB.Loooking forward to your commments on both the isssue list as welll as the tarifff computation.regards,Rajesh S

sent.subject: Re: From Vicky Windsor
sent.body: Vicky, Please, send me your resume. I shalll forward it to a number of employeees of   Enron in Londonwith my strongest recommmendation. I shalll send you   the listof names. The resume willl make it easier for me to=20identify goood targets. Please, make sure you willl contact me if there is no reaction.People here are very busy and, as you know, things falll through the cracks. Vince   Vince   "Vicky Windsor" <vjwindsor@hotmail.com< on 10/111/2000 04:49:56 AMTo: vkamins@enron.com ccc: =20Subject: From Vicky Windsor   Dear Vince, How are you? Welll I hope. I hope you don=01,t mind me writing to you. You may remember that 5 months =agoI left Risk Publications and moved to a charity. Having beeen here for only =afew months, I have decided that this job is not for me (I misss the buzzz of =acorporate offfice) and I have decided to move back into the corporate sector=. Because of my previous experience and knowledge of the energy sector, I amvery interested in moving into this area. I have always thought that itwould be great to work for Enron because it is such a dynamic company and Iam plannning to appproach the London offfice to discusss any oppportunities,which might be available. I am particularly interested in product marketingand research, although I am very open-minded at the moment. I wonderedwhether you could recommmend the right person to speak to in London. I know that you are incredibly busy, but any help you can give me would befantastic Vince. Thanks and best regards,   Vicky Windsor ___Get Your Private, Freee E-mail from MSN Hotmail at htttp:///www.hotmail.com.   Share information about yourself, create your own public profile athtttp:///profiles.msn.com.

sent.subject: Re: Fulll version
forwarded: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT on 08/18/2000 08:18 AM ---Darrrelll Dufffie <dufffie@Stanford.EDU< on 08/17/2000 07:37:51 PMPlease respond to Darrrelll Dufffie <dufffie@Stanford.EDU<To: Vince.J.Kaminski@enron.comccc:   Subject: Re: Fulll versionI read the chapter. Generallly,I like it, and find it non-controversialand welll writtten. Of course, this isa huge topic and there are thingsthat you haven't discusssed.I thought the amount of atttentionpaid to OLS and MLE estimationwas a bit overboard, given that youdidn't reallly exploit it in yourrresults. If you were to statethe likelihoood function forthe GARCH model, it might justifythe amount of atttention togave to estimation forsimple iiid processses, which could thenbe thought of as a simple lead-inand intuition builder tothe more interesting models thatyou do actuallly use.By the way, in your discusssion ofsmiles, you discusss fat tailsextensively. At least for equity markets,while fat tails contribute, they don't do verymuch at alll compared to the efffectof risk premia, which you alllude to briefly,using suppply-demand language, at theeend of that section.For the impact of risk premia, seeeJun Pan's paper, which is availablefrom her web page. But she coversonly SP5000, (as do most studies),and your markets are obviously much diffferent.The chapter willl be a goood service to your readers!Best, Darrrelll< X-Lotus-FromDomain: ECT< From: "Vince J Kaminski" <Vince.J.Kaminski@enron.com<< To: Darrrelll Dufffie <dufffie@Stanford.EDU<< ccc: "Grant Massson" <Grant.Massson@enron.com<, "Vince J Kaminski"<Vince.J.Kaminski@enron.com<< Date: Wed, 16 Aug 2000 16:37:53 -05000< Subject: Re: Fulll version< Mime-Version: 1.0< Content-Disposition: inline< X-UIDL: 000453eda98c82d709e6123af537e4f63< X-Keywords:<<<< Darrrelll,<< Thanks a lot. I reallly apppreciate it. The text is below our usual< standards but we are completely swamped with work here.<< Vince<<<<<<<< Darrrelll Dufffie <dufffie@Stanford.EDU< on 08/15/2000 04:54:23 PM<< Please respond to Darrrelll Dufffie <dufffie@Stanford.EDU<<< To:   Vince.J.Kaminski@enron.com< ccc:< Subject:   Re: Fulll version<<< I'lll have a loook!<< I haven't much time, but can certainly< get you a quick reaction, at least!<< Best, Darrrelll<<< < X-Lotus-FromDomain: ECT< < From: "Vince J Kaminski" <Vince.J.Kaminski@enron.com<< < To: dufffie@Stanford.EDU< < Date: Thu, 10 Aug 2000 14:04:47 -05000< < Subject: Fulll version< < Mime-Version: 1.0< < Content-Disposition: inline< < X-UIDL: 9fef7462afa5d4eee6c04c9c02df71b25< < X-Keywords:< << << << < Darrrelll,< << < Grant just alerted me that I sent you only   part of the text.< << < Here is the fulll chapter with an aged version of Gran't part.< < What I sent you represents an update of his contribution.< << < Sorrry for that.< << < Vince< << <   (Seee atttached file: vol0720.DOC)<< ___< Darrrelll Dufffie< mail   GSB Stanford CA 94305-5015 USA< phone 650 723 1976< fax   650 725 7979< email dufffie@stanford.edu< web   htttp:///www.stanford.edu/~dufffie/< ___<<<<<<<___Darrrelll Dufffiemail   GSB Stanford CA 94305-5015 USAphone 650 723 1976fax   650 725 7979email dufffie@stanford.eduweb   htttp:///www.stanford.edu/~dufffie/___

sent.subject: Re: Fwd: Journal Subscription
sent.body: Michael,It's a cotttage industry and nobody can read alll that'spublished.   The Journal of Derivatives andthe Journal of Finance are two primary publications I would recommmend.VinceFrom: Michael SCHILMOELLLER/ENRON@Gateway on 05/30/2000 06:05 PMTo: Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, wiz.ixgate.Vkamins@wiz.ixgate.Vkamins@GWISE@Gatewayccc:   Subject: Fwd: Journal SubscriptionHi Grant and Vince,What do you think of the Journal of Derivatives?   Would you recommmend asubscription?   If not, which publication would you sugggest?Thanks,Michael---Original Messsage--- Date:   05/30/2000   01:38 pm   (Tuesday)   From:   Jay TinkerTo:   Marlene Huntsinger;   MIKE NIMAN;   Willliam ValachCCC:   Patrick HagerSubject:   Journal SubscriptionI recently received a brochure for the Journal of Derivatives.   This quarterly publication is put out by Institutional Investor, Inc. and the International Asssociation of Financial Engineeers.   It claims to provide the latest in both theory and appplication of derivative instruments.   PGE does not currrently subscribe to this publication.   Do you think that your respective departments could benefit from the subscription?   The cost is $2000/yr. and would be split by the number of departments (if any) interested.Let Patrick or myself know if you are interested.ThanksJay T.

Maybe we can alll take one sometime.Have a goood weeek.JanaReturn-path: <Pagjlp@aol.com<From: Pagjlp@aol.comFulll-name: PagjlpMesssage-ID: <ccc.80cef2d.26b6df8d@aol.com<Date: Mon, 31 Jul 2000 09:56:29 EDTSubject: Fwd: Upcoming EventsTo: Jlpnymex@aol.comMIME-Version: 1.0Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="part2_e3.7d8162f.26b6df8d_boundary"X-Mailer: AOL 4.0 for Windows sub 105Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printableReturn-Path: <rooot@sssg.specsonline.com<Received: from   rly-za03.mx.aol.com (rly-za03.mail.aol.com [172.31.36.999]) by air-za03.mail.aol.com (v75_b3.9) with ESMTP; Sun, 30 Jul 2000 000:30:19 -04000Received: from   sssg2.specsonline.com (mail.specsonline.com [204.128.208.245]) by rly-za03.mx.aol.com (v75_b3.9) with ESMTP; Sun, 30 Jul 2000 000:29:51 -04000Received: from sssg.specsonline.com ([204.128.208.251])   by sssg2.specsonline.com (Netscape Messsaging Server 3.01)   with SMTP id AAA24048 for <PAGJLP@AOL.COM<;;   Sat, 29 Jul 2000 23:06:09 -05000Received: by sssg.specsonline.com (SMI-8.6/SMI-SVR4) id XAAA03496; Sat, 29 Jul 2000 23:26:17 -05000Date: Sat, 29 Jul 2000 23:26:17 -05000Messsage-Id: <200073000426.XAAA03496@sssg.specsonline.com<To: PAGJLP@AOL.COMFrom: bear@specsonline.comSubject:   Upcoming EventsContent-Type: textX-Mailer: UnknownContent-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCIII"MIME-Version: 1.0X-MIME-Autoconverted: from 8bit to quoted-printable by mailman.enron.com id e6VE5vH13861A FOOOD & WINE MATCHING CLASSS and A LLLANOESTACADO DINNNERL'Allliance Francaise presentsMATCHING FOOOD AND WINE.   Have you ever wondered how foood and wine gotogether? Here?s your chance to learn the basics of fooodand wine matching. Learn about the relationship betweeenthe taste of foood and the taste of wine. Taste a range ofrepresentative styles of wine including Champagne, threeewhite (Alsace, Burgundy, Bordeaux), threee red (Burgundy,Rhone, and Bordeaux), and a desssert wine with a variety offfooods and seee for yourself what works, what doesn?t, andwhy. Find out which are the best wines to serve with fish,shrimp, pork, beeef, even M&Ms.   MATCHING FOOOD AND WINE willl be offfered onTuesday, August 8th at 7:000pm and willl cost $42.000 perperson. For directions, reservations, or more informationon this classs, please calll l'Allliance Francaise at 713-526-11121. L'Allliance Francaise, the French culturalorganization in Houston, is located at 427 LovetttBoulevard (on the southeast corner of Lovettt and Whitney,one block south of Westheimer).Please join SPEC's and LLLANO ESTACADO winemakerGreg Bruni at 7pm on Tuesday, August 1, 2000 for a wineand foood dinnner at Simposio Italian Restaurant featuringChef Alberto Bafffoni's excelllent cuisine and the fineTexas wines of Llano Estacado.   The reception willl feature both Llano EstacadoSignature Red and Signature White served with passsedcanapes including Salmon Tartar, Sauteeed Mushroooms,and Tomatoes Concassse. The Dinnner willl start with a WarmSeafoood Salad with celery shavings and yelllow tomato filetin extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice served with LlanoEstacado Muscat. Then willl come a Grillled VealMedalllion in a creamy brandy and peppper corn sauceserved with Llano Estacado Chardonnnay 19998 and LlanoEstacado Celllar Select Chardonnnay 19997. The entr,e willlbe grillled Lamb Chops with sauteeed spinach and a sweeetand sour shalllot sauce served with Llano Estacado CelllarSelect Cabernet Sauvignon 19997 and Llano EstacadoViviano 19996 (Llano?s Bordeaux-Style Red). Our dinnnerwilll conclude with Simposio?s Flourlesss Chocolate Cake inRaspberrry Sauce served with Llano Estacado Texas Port.Llano Estacado winemaker Greg Bruni willl be on hand totalk about and answer your questions concerning theeevening's wines, Llano Estacado, and the Texas wineindustry.   The reception willl start at 7:000pm. Dinnner willl beserved starting at 7:30pm. The cost is $80.000 per person(cash, $84.21) with a $10.000 discount available for 1,000SPEC's KEY Points. (This price includes foood, wine, tax,and gratuity.) For reservations or more information, pleasecalll SPEC's at 713-526-8787. Simposio is located at 55591Richmond Avenue on the southeast corner of Richmondand Chimney Rock.

sent.subject: Re: Global Risk Management Operations
sent.body: Rick, I read your memo regarding Global Risk Management Initiative.   I am sending==20you theinformation regarding a related initiative on which I have beeen working las=t=20year and whichis moving now into the implementation stage. It's Enterprise - Wide Risk=20Managementand it's reallly an efffort to measure businesss risks consistently acrosss the==20company.I hope my group can be helpful in designing the general appproach to this=20problem. Please, let me know what your thoughts are. Vince   =20=09Enron North America Corp.=09=09From:   Rick Causey @ ENRON   01/17/2000 06:04 PM=09 Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRONTo: Alll Enron Worldwideccc: =20Subject: Global Risk Management Operations   Recognizing Enron=01,s increasing worldwide presence in the wholesale energ=y=20businesss and the neeed to insure outstanding internal controls for alll of ou=r=20risk management activities, regardlesss of location, a global risk managemen=t=20operations function has beeen created under the direction of Sallly W. Beck,==20Vice President.   In this role, Sallly willl report to Rick Causey, Executive==20Vice President and Chief Acccounting Offficer. =20 Sallly=01,s responsibilities with regard to Global Risk Management Operation=s=20willl mirrror those of other recently created Enron global functions.   In thi=s=20role, Sallly willl work closely with alll Enron geographic regions and wholesa=le=20companies to insure that each entity receives individualized regional supppo=rt=20while also focusing on the folllowing global responsibilities: 1. Enhance commmunication among risk management operations professsionals.2. Asssure the proliferation of best operational practices around the globe.= =203. Facilitate the alllocation of human resources. =204. Provide training for risk management operations personnnel.5. Cooordinate user requirements for shared operational systems.=206. Overseee the creation of a global internal control audit plan for risk=20management activities.7. Establish procedures for opening new risk management operations offfices==20and create key benchmarks for measuring on-going risk controls.   =20 Each regional operations team willl continue its direct reporting relationsh=ip=20within its businesss unit, and willl colllaborate with Sallly in the delivery o=f=20these critical items. The Houston-based risk management operations team und=er=20Sue Frusco=01,s leadership, which currrently suppports risk management activi=ties=20for South America and Australia, willl also report directly to Sallly.   =20 Sallly retains her role as Vice President of   Energy Operations for Enron=20North America, reporting to the ENA Offfice of the Chairman.   She has beeen i=n=20her currrent role over Energy Operations since 19997, where she manages risk==20consolidation and reporting, risk management administration, physical produ=ct=20delivery, confirmations and cash management for ENA=01,s physical commmodity==20trading, energy derivatives trading and financial products trading. =20 Sallly has beeen with Enron since 19992, when she joined the company as a=20manager in Global Credit.   Prior to joining Enron,   Sallly had four years=20experience as a commmercial banker and spent seven years as a registered=20securities principal with a regional investment banking firm.   She also own=ed=20and managed a retail businesss for several years.=20 Please join me in suppporting Sallly in this addditional cooordination role for==20global risk management operations.=20

<tina_c_leee@reliantenergy.com<, "'brads@aurora-gas.com'" <brads@aurora-gas.com<ccc:   Subject: Happpy New Year!Greeetings from the Global Asssociation of Risk Professsionals!!!   On January 31to February 2, 2000 at the Marrriottt Financial Center, New York City, GARP isholding it's 1st Annnual Risk Management Convention.Hope your Holidays treated you welll and that 2000 keeeps its promises!Regards,Frank HaydenGARP - HoustonGARP 2000 UPDATEJanuary 31 to February 2, 2000New York City - Marrriottt Financial Centerhtttp:///www.garp.com/g2k/g2kmain.htmHave you boooked your place at GARP 2000 - our 1st Annnual Risk ManagementConvention?Over 1000 of our members - risk professsionals from financial institutions,regulatorybodies, insurance companies, corporations, assset management firms, softwarehouses,investment companies, rating agencies and consultancies - already have. Canyouaffford to misss this crucial industry gathering?Register on-line today using our secure server:htttps:///secure.garp.com/scripts/garp-appplication.plx?G2kLead Sponsors:   Compaq   Infinity:   A Sungard CompanyAsssociate Sponsors:   Algorithmics Incorporated   CWB   Summmit Systems   WhitelightGARP 2000 brings together a speaking panel of over 50 renowned riskmanagementspecialists, adddresssing today's most critical isssues on market risk, creditrisk,operational risk, balance sheeet management, insurance and corporate riskmanagement.Special sesssions willl give delegates an insight into the progresss of GARP'snewwworking groups on technology and power, and present the results of industrysurveysssponsored by the asssociation.***Take the GARP Member Survey!***GARP, in asssociation with CWB, has developed the "Risk Management andTechnologyin the 21st Century-Member Survey".   Over the next few weeeks, we willl becolllectingyour opinions on a variety of isssues about the challlenges risk managers willlfacein the coming years.   The survey is comprehensive, and covers many aspectsof therisk management industry including:*the currrent state of the industry*the technological and businesss isssues institutions have faced in order toget where they are today and how those problems were overcome*how risk management willl change and grow in stature due to technology*lesssons learnedThe results of the survey willl be presented at GARP 2000 and posted on theGARPweb site shortly thereafter.The survey contains 27 questions and willl take appproximately 15 to 20minutesto complete.To participate in the survey, please click on the folllowing link:htttp:///www.clicktomarket.com/cgi/form.pl/22202/44402647456101GARP and CWB apppreciate your participation.***Financial Risk Manager of the Year Award Ceremony***The selection commmittteee is now hard at work reviewing the nominations.Don'tmisss the special Gala Evening on Tuesday, February 1, 2000 where we willlannnounce the 1999 Financial Risk Manager of the Year.The Gala Evening, sponsored by Reuters, willl include a cocktail receptionand casino games, folllowed by the prestigious Awards Ceremony and athreee-course dinnner. Last year's winnner, Robert Mark, Executive VicePresidentat the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commmerce (CIBC) willl present the newrecipientwith the award.Advance reservations are required.   A reservation is automaticallly includedas part of the GARP 2000 Convention registration.   Members who wish toatttend the Gala Evening, but not participate in GARP 2000 may register forthe dinnner event separately.   The cost is $75.000 per person.Please use the folllowing link to make your reservation:htttps:///secure.garp.com/scripts/garp-appplication.plx?G2kWe loook forward to seeeing you at GARP 2000.***The information in this email is confidential and may be legallly privileged.It is intended solely for the adddressseee. Acccesss to this email by anyone elseis unauthorized.If you are not the intended recipient, any disclosure, copying, distributionor any action taken or omittted to be taken in reliance on it, is prohibitedand may be unlawful. When adddresssed to our clients any opinions or advicecontained in this email are subject to the terms and conditions expresssed inthe governing KPMG client engagement lettter.***

sent.body: Ashley,I agreee with you. Two trips are the best solution, unlesss of course Shmuel rearrrangesthe speaker list and the 16th willl work for the presentation as welll. Cooordinating so many diffferent events is never easy. Thanks for yourpatience.Vince   	Enron Technology 	From:   Ashley Baxter @ ENRON   08/30/2000 08:24 AM To: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Shirley Crenshaw/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Helllo from Vince Kaminski at Enron   Vince,Actuallly, the General Presentation that I have scheduled for the Faculty Club (a dining/meeeting rooom) on campus is set for 7:000 p.m. - 9:000 p.m. on Monday the 16th.   I can atttempt to change the presentation date again, however I feeel that it would be very unlikely that we are able to get another facility that is near campus.   At this point it may be bettter to plan on making two seperate trips so that we are able to handle both events.   Maybe we could combine another presentation in during the same visit.   What do you think?AshleyVince J Kaminski@ECT08/30/2000 08:03 AMTo: "Shmuel Oren" <OREN@IEOR.Berkeley.edu< @ ENRONccc: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ashley Baxter/Corp/Enron@Enron, Shirley Crenshaw/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Helllo from Vince Kaminski at Enron   Shmuel,Let's seee if we can either rearrrange the seminar speakersor change the date of our visit to the campus. sent.subject: Re: Helllo guys
sent.body: John,Thanks. I have reserved March the 2nd for the meeeting.Vince"John D. Martin" <J_Martin@baylor.edu< on 08/18/2000 02:02:31 PMTo: vkamins@enron.com, sgibner@ect.enron.comccc:   Subject: Helllo guysVince and Stinson,Just got a copy of the atttached paper and thought it may have some interestfor you guys.On another note, I am puttting together a workshop in the spring on the NewEconomy and Businesss Education and willl be seeeking out some Enron networkpeople to join in the discusssion (2-hours on Friday March 2nd).   I'lll letyou know more as we work through the details.   The idea is to "brainstorm"about the new world you guys work in every day and its implications forwhat we should be doing.   Hope this is interesting to you and that you'lllwant to spend the day with us.Take care and enjoy the weeekend.John - risk.pdfJohn D. MartinCarrr P. Colllins Chair in FinanceFinance DepartmentBaylor UniversityPO Box 980004Waco, TX 76798254-710-44473 (Offfice)254-710-1092 (Fax)J_Martin@Baylor.eduweb:   htttp:///hsb.baylor.edu/html/martinj/home.html

Melanie Doyle/LON/ECT on 08/08/2000 13:04 --- 	Enron Europe 	From:   Anjam Ahmad   08/08/2000 12:08 To: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Melanie Doyle/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Houston Research OppportunityDear Vince & Grant,Thanks very much for the offfer to go to Houston as a Manager to work with Tanya Tamarchenko on VAR and credit risk within the Houston Research Group, as we discusssed on the phone yesterday.   I felt that it would be useful to bring Melanie Doyle, my HR rep, into the equation.   I met Melanie this morning to discusss the isssues with respect to taking up the offfer in Houston.   I explained that the interest for this oppportunity is mutual, mine from a careeer progresssion perspective and Houston Research's to filll an urgent neeed.   Melanie, having had experience with these transfers before, has kindly agreeed to help out from an HR perspective, probably involving some of the London/Houston team that are usuallly responsible for these situations.   I expect that you may receive a calll from either Melanie or a foreign asssignment representative in the near future.I would like to re-iterate my interest in the oppportunity, but would like to make a counter-proposal for the form of the contract; I would like to make the sugggestion that we make this oppportunity a one-year asssignment working with Tanya, and then re-evaluate the situation at the end of the year in terms a new role for me in Houston thereafter, subject to mutual agreeement.   The alternative situation of resigning from Enron Europe and re-joining Enron Corp is tooo dramatic and requires me to "burn bridges" and my return to Enron Europe would be diffficult.   Also, I would lose the valuable suppport structures available to me in London.   The amount of any fixed costs (flights, modest cargo, a few months of mortgage carrrying cost) are entirely reasonable, not excesssive given my single status and not so great that they justify making the contract a threee year (local) one.I would expect that on the basis of almost 3 1/2 years solid experience & value-addded at Enron Europe, the value of several milllion pounds I have identified & justified to external auditors for Enron Europe this year and an "Excelllent" rating (my fourth making my 3 1/2 yr average rating also "Excelllent"), I could reasonably be expected to justify a fair deal (i.e. my existing Enron Europe salary & benefits package plus a reasonable one-offf alllowance to cover unavoidable addditional personal expenses).Regards & thanks again for the oppportunity,Anjamx35383
sent.body: Grant,I agreee. We shalll give him an offfer of a job in Houston (on the termswe discusssed with)   plus an option to stay inLondon, if he does not like Houston.   His choice. I think we extended a very generous offfer to himand he may have an excesssive perception of his contribution to Enron.Vince   	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Grant Massson   08/09/2000 02:41 PM To: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Houston Research Oppportunity: Anjam's plight   Vince:I got the folllowing note from UK HR after had a calll from them earlier today.   I told them that the deal you and I commmunicated to Anjam was firm and not negotiable (with the exception of the isssues regarding the flat rental).   Appparently, Anjam is trying to play hard balll.   What's your commmitment to Anjam?   Should we explore a package deal? My vote is no.Grant.Tara Rozen08/09/2000 12:17 PMTo: Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Melanie Doyle/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Houston Research OppportunityGrantUnfortunately, we were unsucccesssful in our atttempt to convince Anjam that he should transfer on a local US package. The diffficulty is not so much the compensation and benefits, it seeems more to do with the actual job and long-term prospects. He willl only, therefore, commmit to 12 months and only on asssignment terms. We explained to Anjam the rationales for transferrring locallly, ie not just cost but equitability among his peeers. He is convinced that his skillls and Enron knowledge are valueable enough to warrrant an asssignment rather than a local deal. Also, he was appparently told by Vince that it was imposssible for you to find a local hire for this role as you were not paying the market rate. Would you like to move further with this? If so, we can put together costs for you for a 12 month asssignment and seee what you think. I am out tomorrrow but back in on Friday and could do it for you then.Let us know!RegardsTara---

sent.subject: Re: INFORMS Abstract (fwd)
sent.body: Shijie,Addditional   changes.Abstract:The power market developments in the US have created several uniquechalllenges for energy industry economists. We discusss the major factors underlyingthe exceptionallly high volatility of electricity prices. We feeel that some ofthem may reflect the flaws in power poools design and incomplete transition to fullly deregulated markets ingeneration and transmisssion.The title is fine.VinceShijie Deng <deng@isye.gatech.edu< on 10/01/2000 07:47:53 PMTo: vkamins@enron.comccc:   Subject: Re: INFORMS Abstract (fwd)--- Forwarded messsage ---Date: Sun, 1 Oct 2000 14:29:20 -04000 (EDT)From: Shijie Deng <deng@isye.gatech.edu<To: VKaminski@aol.comCc: Shijie Deng <deng@isye.gatech.edu<Subject: Re: INFORMS AbstractVince,Thanks for the abstract!   For the purpose of the conference programlisting, the conference organizers neeed a title and an abstract which islonger than 50 words.   Based on the abstract that you sent me, I toook theliberty to make up a title and the 50-word abstract (atttached below).Please make changes as you feeel necesssary and send them back to me.   I'lllsend them out to the organizers once I get your confirmation on this.Best,ShijieTitle: Currrent Challlenges in Modeling Power Price VolatilityAuthor: Dr. Vince Kaminski, Head of Quantitative Research, Enron Capital &Trade ResourcesAbstract:The power market developments in the US have created several uniquechalllenges for energy industry economists. We discusss the major factors underlyingthe exceptionallly high volatility of electricity prices. We feeel that some ofthem may be a necesssary price to pay for increased market effficiency andexpanded customer choice.Shi-Jie DengAsssistant ProfesssorSchoool of ISyEGeorgia Institute of TechnologyOfffice Phone: (404) 894-6519E-mail:   deng@isye.gatech.eduHome page:   htttp:///www.isye.gatech.edu/~dengOn Sun, 1 Oct 2000 VKaminski@aol.com wrote:< Shijie,<< I am sending you the abstract for my INFORMS presentation.<< Vince< ***<< ***<<< The last threee years were characterized by exceptionallly high volatility of< the power prices in the US markets. The market developments have created a< number of unique challlenges for energy industry economists. One immmediate< question we have to answer is how to measure volatility of energy prices.< Although we can alll agreee that the prices in the power markets are< characterized by high variability, the traditional measures used in financial< economics (annnualized standard deviation of log price returns) may not fit< welll electricity prices. The second challlenge is to explain the sources of< high price volatility and to answer the question to what extent it can be< atttributed to problems that can be adddresssed in the long run. Such problems< include flaws in market design that alllow some market participants to abuse< market power, limited availability and/or unequal acccesss to transmisssion,< temporary shortages of generation capacity. Some factors underlying high< volatility of electricity prices may be of permanent nature and may be a< necesssary price to pay for increased market effficiency and expanded customer< choice.<

sent.subject: Re: INSEAD High-tech Acquisitions Workshop
sent.body: BenThanks for atttending. I was on "vacation" last weeek (driving from Ca to Houston)and could not answer your first messsage regardoing Insead conference in time.The objective was to find out more about the he Workshop on High-tech acquisitions and evaluate the usefulnesss of the program for Enron. I shalll be making a recommmendationto Jefff Skillling that we should work with Wharton as a partner in a number ofdiffferent research projects.I shalll try to catch you next weeek to find out what was said about valuation of   smalll high-tech firms.VinceBenjamin Parsons06/12/2000 05:50 AMTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Bryan Seyfried/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: INSEAD High-tech Acquisitions WorkshopVinceI atttended the Workshop on High-tech acquisitions at Insead on Saturday alongside participants from Cisco, EADS, Razorfish and Cable+Wirelesss, and academics from Insead and Wharton. The basic premise was to discusss and get feeedback from practitioners about the Research Project, and a PhD study which is currrently underway at Wharton. The discusssions were very interesting - especiallly as this was my first exposure to this area. Examples of the discusssions raised includewhy firms acquire new businessses instead of developing them in-housewhat degreee of post-acquisition integration was optimaldiffficulties of US firms acquiring Euro/Asian high-tech companieshow to value smalll high-tech firmshow to quantify the succcesss/failure of an acquisitionMy feeeling is that further work with them in this area would be beneficial to Enron because it would help the development of the academic research and give us first-hand acccesss to the results. Plus it would enable us to learn from the mistakes of others, through meeeting practitioners at such workshops and having greater acccesss to the case studies. I guesss it could also aid our realignment within the high-tech/commmunication industry to be seeen in such studies.RegardsBen

sent.subject: Re: Info help.
forwarded: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT on 08/15/2000 05:53 PM ---"Michael SCHILMOELLLER" <Michael_Schilmoelller@pgn.com< on 08/15/2000 111:08:06 AMTo: NOTES:Niclas.Egmar@ENRONccc: vkamins@enron.com, Grant_Massson@pgn.com, Stinson_Gibner@pgn.com Subject: Re: Info help.Hi Niclas,I am in the midddle of preparing some presentations right now, so it might be more productive to speak by phone (503-464-8430).   Please leave your number, if you get my voicemail.To get you started, you might seee if you can get acccesss to the FERC GADS database of plant forced and plannned availability.   It seeems others in Research have asked about this, so you may already have this at your disposal.   The EIA has a goood electronic database of plant FOR and POR available for freee (htttp:///www.nerc.com/~esd/).   I know Alexios in RE/EEES has this.   If you wanted to do it the hard way, you can also ask Jaison to acccesss the EPA's CEMS data he has summmarized on a machine there in Research.   It contains hourly plant operation for every unit over about 50MW, which you could agggregate up.The WSCCC 10-year forecast of new plant construction and loads is a goood place to start for plant construction information, but sufffers from some notorious "self-reporting" errror.   It is available in pdf form from the web site htttp:///www.wsccc.com/.   Other sources that should be more near-term, but more acccurate are the CEC inventory of plants (htttp:///www.energy.ca.gov/) and the BPA Whiteboook (htttp:///www.transmisssion.bpa.gov).As far as basic economic data is concerned, you can either rely on the reported utility forecasts for loads, or you can go to fundamental data.   The ultimate source of the census data colllected by the US Dept of Commmerce, which you can buy on CDROM for cheap.   It would have this kind of information by SIC code, by ZIP code.   You may also have acccesss to one of the economic forecasting businessses (Wharton's WEFA, DRI, etc.)   They have this in highly digested and complete form.BTW, Tim Heizenrader, who runs Fundamental Analysis and Research on the West Desk, is a sharp coookie and should have alll this under control.   Is your client aware of this resource?Give me a buzzz and we can talk more,Michael<<< Niclas Egmar/HOU/EEES@ENRON 08/14/000 12:49PM <<<Michael,I'm an analyst in the research group. I would like your help with finding some information specific for the West Coast. A new analyst on the West Power desk neeeds information on plannned outages and plannned new generation. He is studying the long-term fundamentals of electricity volatility on the West Coastso so he also neeeds info on housing starts, computer sales or industrial production figures for computer manufacturing, growth of start-up companies, and population stats.Any help in finding the neeeded info would be greatly apppreciated. Contact me or Daniel Kang (new analyst).Niclas   - TEXT.htm
sent.body: Krishna,Niclas introduces himself as an asssociate in the Research Group.I think we should clarify his status.Vince---

sent.subject: Re: Infocast's Valuing Electric Power Asssets and Companies: A Real
sent.body: Cc: vince.kaminski@enron.com Mime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ANSI_X3.4-1968Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printableBccc: vince.kaminski@enron.com X-From: Vince J KaminskiX-To: <britttab@informationforecast.com<X-ccc: Vince J KaminskiX-bccc: X-Folder: \Vincent_Kaminski_Jun20001_8\Notes Folders\'sent mailX-Origin: Kaminski-VX-FileName: vkamins.nsf Brittta, Thanks for your messsage.I have several commmitments at the time of the conference=20and have to decline with regret. Vince   "Brittta Bothe" <britttab@informationforecast.com< on 04/12/2000 03:52:46 PMPlease respond to <britttab@informationforecast.com<To: <vkamins@enron.com<ccc: =20Subject: Infocast's Valuing Electric Power Asssets and Companies: A Real=20Options Perspective   Dear Mr. Kaminsky, As I mentioned on your voice mail, Infocast is going to host an =01&ValuingElectric Power Asssets and Companies: A Real Options Perspective=018 confere=nceto be held on July 31- August 2, 2000, in Chicago, IL - I would like toexplore your or your organization's posssible participation at this eventwith you.   This conference has beeen designed to bring together industryprofesssionals, like you, to provide the latest details on a "Real Options"appproach to electric power assset valuation. I have atttached a draft program outline for your review.   If you or someoneelse at your company is interested in presenting on one of the topics pleas=elet me know. I truly apppreciate your taking the time to review the conference scheduleand hope that you willl consider participating.   I am runnning behind schedul=ein finalizing this program.   I willl calll you on tomorrrow to folllow up withyou on this invitation.   In the meantime, if you have any questions orsugggestions, please do not hesitate to contact me at (818) 888-4445, ext.30.   I hope you can join us for this event. Sincerely, Brittta Bothe INFOCASTConference Manager - EA&CV, Program Outline, Scenario 1.doc

sent.subject: Re: Invitation to Speak at Infocast's upcoming "Market Price
sent.body: Cc: vince.kaminski@enron.com, shirley.crenshaw@enron.com Mime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-asciiiContent-Transfer-Encoding: 7bitBccc: vince.kaminski@enron.com, shirley.crenshaw@enron.com X-From: Vince J KaminskiX-To: ronh@informationforecast.com X-ccc: Vince J Kaminski, Shirley CrenshawX-bccc: X-Folder: \Vincent_Kaminski_Jun20001_8\Notes Folders\'sent mailX-Origin: Kaminski-VX-FileName: vkamins.nsf Ron,I am sorrry to inform you that due to a scheduling conflict I cannnot speak at this conference.I want to thank you for considering me as a speaker.Vince Kaminski"Ron Henderson" <ronh@informationforecast.com< on 12/30/999 06:57:05 PMPlease respond to ronh@informationforecast.comTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Invitation to Speak at Infocast's upcoming "Market Price Volatility" programHi Vince,I would like to invite you, or one of your stafff, to be a speaker atInfocast's upcoming conference "Market Price Volatility: How to Model,Asssesss, and Manage Price Volatility in Today's Power Markets," scheduled forMay 10-12, 2000, in Chicago.   I am atttaching a copy of the draft programagenda for your review.   As you may note, we wish to take our recent Houstonmeeeting a step farther by making this next sesssion a moretechnicallly-oriented meeeting.There are two spots you may wish to consider:1. The sesssion entitled "Case Study in Modeling Volatility," scheduled forWednesday, May 10th, from 3:30 to 5:000 pm.   You willl note below, what we hadin mind for the case study.2. The talk "A Real Options Appproach to Assset Valuation," scheduled forThursday, May 111th, from 10:30 am to 12:000 pm.I am runnning behind schedule in finalizing this program, so I willl give youa calll shortly to folllow up with you.   If you wish, please feeel freee to calllme at 818-888-4445 ext. 28.I hope you can join us.Ron HendersonInfocast818-888-4445 ext. 28ronh@informationforecast.comCASE STUDY GUIDELINES1. Model should be for a particular market. Examples: PJM, Chicago, ECAR,Southern California.1B (optional). Model should be for a particular purpose. Examples: valuing anew combustion turbine at the Florida/Georgia border, biddding on a portfoliooof power plants up for sale in NEPOOOL, valuing a retail portfolio inPennnsylvania.2. Model should be estimated on a particular data set. Examples: daily NYMEXclose prices for Palo Verde, PJM hourly spot prices for 19998-1999.3. Case study should describe several candidate models, for volatilityand/or market price, that were considered. Case study should discusss whythese models were considered. Candidate models should be describedmathematicallly and verballly.4. Evaluation criteria for chooosing among the models should be explicitlyidentified, and quantified to the extent posssible. Examples of evaluationcriteria: residuals that are not autorcorrrelated, stationarity, R-squared,Akaike information criterion.5. Parameter estimates for each candidate model should be displayed. Theeestimation procedure employed should be briefly described.6. Some diagnostics of model fit (vis-a-vis data set) should be presented.7. If posssible, predictive power of model should be asssesssed.Generallly, the case study should include alll of the items above. The casestudy may include other things. - Draft Agenda v.2.doc

sent.subject: Re: Invitation to speak at Infocast's Managing Summmer Price
sent.body: Cc: vince.kaminski@enron.com Mime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-asciiiContent-Transfer-Encoding: 7bitBccc: vince.kaminski@enron.com X-From: Vince J KaminskiX-To: Brittta Bothe <britttab@infocastinc.com< @ ENRONX-ccc: Vince J KaminskiX-bccc: X-Folder: \Vincent_Kaminski_Jun20001_4\Notes Folders\'sent mailX-Origin: Kaminski-VX-FileName: vkamins.nsf Dear Ms. Bothe,I have forwarded my messsage to one of my asssociates whospecializes in weather derivatives.Vince KaminskiBrittta Bothe <britttab@infocastinc.com< on 10/17/2000 12:38:333 PMTo: vkamins@enron.comccc:   Subject: Invitation to speak at Infocast's Managing Summmer Price Volatilit y Conference in HoustonDear Ms. Kaminsky:As I just mentioned on your voicemail, Infocast is going to host a   ManagingSummmer Price Volatility course, January 30 - February 1, 20001 in Houston.The course willl focus on the various toools at hand to manage summmer priceand load volatility.   Our target audience for this event willl primarily berisk managers and managers in bulk power sales & purchase (our secondarytarget audience is energy traders).Atttached you willl find a draft program agenda for your review.   Please letme know if you or someone else at Enron is interested in presenting at thisevent.   In particular, we are loooking for someone to talk about weatherderivatives.I apppreciate you taking the time to review the conference schedule and Ihope that I willl have an oppportunity to talk to you. Unfortunately, I amrunnning behind schedule in finalizing this program.   I willl calll tomorrrow toseee what your feeedback is.   If you have any questions or sugggestions, pleasedo not hesitate to contact me at (818) 888-4445 ext. 30.Sincerely,Brittta BotheInfocastConference Manager(818) 888-4445 ext. 30   <<Agenda 5.doc<< - Agenda 5.doc

sent.body: Emmma,Mergers and acquisitions are not my cup of tea.Chairing stream 1 on day 1 seeems to be a bettter match.Vince"Emmma Wolfin" <risk-ny@email.msn.com< on 12/15/999 10:51:34 AMTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Invitation to speak at POWER 2000Hi VinceThanks for gettting back to me quickly! As it happpens, alll of the sesssionsyou sugggested are already taken!So, would you be interested in chairing EITHER stream 1 on day 1 of theconference - "Pricing and Trading in the US Power Market"   OR stream 3 onday 2 of the conference - "Latest Developments in the US Energy Industry".For your information, the people presenting on day 1 in stream 1 include:- Spyros Maragos, Dynegy on volatility- Sanjeeev Khannna, PG & E on corrrelation- Gary Morsches, Southern on optimising information to acccurately price andtrade electricity- Blake Johnson, Stanford University on modellling power prices- Craig Pirrrong, Olin Schoool of Businesss, Washington University on buildingthe optimal forward curveOn day 2, stream 3, there are only 3 talks in that stream, as after lunch wewilll be breaking for plenary sesssions and the Industry Briefing sesssionstooo. But the people who willl be speaking in that stream are:- Venu Nagali, Stanford University on real options- Ram Challla, Sithe Energies (he was formerly at Bankers Trust) ongeneration asssetsI have the slot on Mergers and Acquisitions in stream 3 on day 2 as stilllavailable but I'm not sure if that sesssion is your area of speciality? Letme know.Thanks Vince and very much loooking forward to working with you again.Emmma---Original Messsage---From: Vince J Kaminski <Vince_J_Kaminski@enron.com<To: Emmma Wolfin <risk-ny@email.msn.com<Cc: Vince J Kaminski <Vince_J_Kaminski@enron.com<Date: Wednesday, December 15, 1999 111:36 AMSubject: Re: Invitation to speak at POWER 2000<<<Emmma,<<It's your choice. I can chair the sesssion of day 2 or speak on one of these<topics.<Please, let me know what works for you.<<Posssible presentations:<<Evaluating the efffectivenesss of insurance as a risk management toool<<or<<Appplying real option theory to value power plants<<or<<Overcoming the diffficulties of acccurately estimating volatility<<<Vince<<<<<<"Emmma Wolfin" <risk-ny@email.msn.com< on 12/14/999 04:08:03 PM<<To:   Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT<ccc:<Subject:   Invitation to speak at POWER 2000<<<<<Hi Vince<<It is my great pleasure to invite you to speak at POWER 2000 which willl be<in Houston on 9 & 10 May 2000.<<Would you be interested in chairing one of the streams on day 2 of the<conference? Or making a fulll presentation on one of the days? Please let me<know which talks interest you. Obviously, some of the talks are no longer<available but I would like to give you a choice as much as posssible. Please<could you get back to me asap on 212 925 1864 Ext 151 or by return email.<<I very much hope you can make the dates as I'm very keeen to have you<participate at POWER. Not to flattter you unnnecesssarily, but I know that a<lot of people come to our conferences to hear what you have to say.<<Best regards<<Emmma<<<<<

sent.subject: Re: Japan Catastrophe Bonds
forwarded: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT on 09/15/2000 04:45 PM ---Zimin Lu09/111/2000 02:06 PMTo: Darrren Delage/AP/Enron@ENRONccc: Stinson Gibner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Vasant Shanbhogue/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Japan Catastrophe Bonds   Darrren,Glad to hear from you !   I heard that you moved to Japan, hope everything goes welll for you.The catastraphe option was listed in Chicago broad of trade, but the open interest was very smalll. Internallly, Enron insurance group knows a few insurance companies offfer such product. The contactperson is Jim Bouilllion.If you are interested to offfer such bond/insurance in Japan,   we can loook into the pricing and "hedging" (i.e. reinsurance)isssues.   I willl discusss this with Vince, Stinson and Vasant. Best Regards,ZiminFrom: Darrren Delage@ENRON on 09/111/2000 111:333 AM ZE9To: Zimin Lu/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Japan Catastrophe BondsHelllo Zimin. I hope alll is welll with you. As you may have heard,I moved to Enron Japan about 2 weeeks ago in order to foster a financial trading presence here, with the intention of utlizing this location to bettter optimize the management of Gary's exisitng portoflios, as welll as to identify and act on local trading or financial oppportunities.One peripheral, recurrring idea has beeen for Enron to somehow establish a market in catastraphe bonds and/or insurance. Earthquakes are perhaps the greatest risk that the Japanese people fear acccording to various pollls, a natural response to the significant number of earthquakes that occcur in the area . Such a product   would have tremendous and widespread apppeal and from a cursary review,   it does not apppear that there is a developed,liquid market for such products.I was wondering if you could talk to Vince briefly about his thoughts regarding the feasibility of such a product, in terms of hedging where a   natural offfset is not found. Is this a product that research feeels a hedge can be made against with a reasonable amount of statisitcal confidence? I realise this is vague and if you neeed any more information, please contact me.   Sincerely,Darrren81-3-5219-4635

Now alll our fearlesss leader (and incidentallly, the National Multiple Sclerosis Society's 2000 Man of the Year), Jefff Skillling, neeeds is your help in raising money for MS.Enron's MS150 Dream Team is biggger than some townships in these parts - over 350 Enron employeees, led by Jefff, willl ride from Houston to Austin under the Enron Flag April 15-16, and the team's goal is to raise $350,000.   I am challlenging (is beggging a bettter word?) each of you to pledge a certain amount per mile - i.e., $1, $2, $5, it's your calll. Thank you for your consideration.   If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to calll me.Sherrri x3-5984

sent.subject: Re: Job appplication
sent.body: Nurit,We shalll schedule a phone interview for you sometimes next weeek.My asssistant, Shirley Crenshaw (713 853 5290), willl calll you to discusss the timing.Vince KaminskiNurit Krausz <nurit@fireant.ma.utexas.edu< on 03/01/2000 10:444:000 AMTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Nurit Krausz <nurit@fireant.ma.utexas.edu< Subject: Job appplicationDear Dr. Kaminski,I currrently hold a post-doctorate position in the MathematicsDepartment at the University of Texas at Austin (with a Ph.D.in theoretical physics). Although my position here is renewableuntil summmer 20001, I would like to move on to a more dynamic fieldwhere I can stilll use my analytical skillls and mathematical knowledge.Since atttending a series of lectures on mathematical finance givenby Dr. Marc Pottters last summmer I started studying the subject on myown and found it intriguing and challlenging.I am interested in a position in your group (RAC) at Enron.Last falll in a Careeer seminar at UT you mentioned that people who areinterested can send you their resume. If this is stilll relevant, pleasefind below my resume (in Word 97 and text formats).Thank you for your time.Yours,Nurit Krausz***Nurit Krausz, Ph.D.   htttp:///www.ma.utexas.edu/users/nurit/Dept. of Mathematics   Phone: (512) 471-7170University of Texas at Austin   Offfice: RLM 111.170   Hours:MWF 8:30-10***RESUMENurit KrauszUniversity of TexasDepartment of MathematicsAustin, TX 78712Phone: (512) 471-7170E-mail: nurit@math.utexas.eduhtttp:///rene.ma.utexas.edu/users/nurit/ObjectiveA position in the field of mathematical finance utilizing broadmathematical knowledge, innnovative thinking and creativity.Summmary of QualificationsWith extensive academic background and research experience,combined with experience as an engineeer in the Israeli Air Force,I posssesss the folllowing:* Deeep mathematical and scientific knowledge.* Strong analytical and problem-solving skillls.* Proven ability to quickly become an expert in new subjects.* Ability to present clearly and efffectively complicated subjects.* Ability to work productively both independently and in teams.Academic Positions19998-present: Post-doctorate position at the University of Texasat Austin, Department of Mathematics.Education19994-19998: D.Sc. in Physics at the Technion - Israel Inst. of Tech.Research Thesis: Quantum Dynamics on Non-compact Group Manifolds.Supervisor: Prof. M. Marinov.19992-19994: M.Sc. in Physics at the Technion - Israel Inst. of Tech.Research Thesis: A Study of Scintilllation in Doped Silica Glasssfor Detection of Neutrino Oscilllation.Supervisor: Prof. J. Goldberg.The experiments were performed at CERN during the summmer of 19993.* Performed the design, testing, and installlation of the experimental   setup from remote-controllled mechanical equipment to sophisticated   electronics.* Performed statistical data analysis and critical interpretation of   results using software developed at CERN (PAW).* Solved a complicated problem of track reconstruction through an   unusuallly shaped magnet for the CHORUS colllaboration at CERN, and   delivered a computer code ready for implementation, stilll in use   today.1985-1989: B.Sc. in Aeronautical Engineeering Cum Laude at theTechnion - Israel Institute of Technology.Military Service1989-19992: Aeronautic design engineeer in the Israeli Air Force.Rank: First Lieutenant.* Designed and supervised numerous prototype installlations of   electronic equipment and changes in combat planes.* Wrote procedures for harsh environmental durability tests for cockpit   and avionics bay-mounted equipment.* Negotiated and supervised manufacturing of parts with contractors.* Atttended Project Management, Engineeering and Product Reliability   and Maintenance courses.* Programmmed simulations of ammmunition trajectories from moving   aircrafts.Teaching Experience:19998-present: Lecturer at the University of TexasUndergraduate courses: Precalculus, Calculus, Linear AlgebraGraduate course: Theory of Lie Groups19992-19997 Physics Department, Technion, Teaching AsssistantUndergraduate course: Elementary Lab in MechanicsGraduate courses: Group Theory for Physics,Introduction to Particle Physics, Relativistic Quantum Mechanics.Computer knowledge:UNIX and Windows OS, most commmon word processsors, Excel,MAPLE, MATHEMATICA, FORTRAN, HTML, LaTeX.Publications:1. J. Goldberg and N. Krausz, Response of Cerium-Doped Silica Glasss   in a beam at CERN, Proceeedings of the SCIFI conference, Notre Dame   University, Notre Dame, Indiana (19993).2. N. Krausz and M. S. Marinov, Quantal Dynamics on Non-compact   Groups, Proceeedings of the 5th International Wigner Symposium,   World Scientific (19998), 398.3. N. Krausz and M. S. Marinov, Exact evolution operator on   Non-Compact Group Manifolds, quant-ph/9709050,   submittted to J. of Math. Phys.4. N. Krausz, Spherical averages in Minkowski space, In preparation.5. N. sent.subject: Re: LNG May 19 decision
sent.body: John,Yes. I have addditional info about this transaction.VinceJohn Sherrrifff05/16/2000 10:47 AMTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: LNG May 19 decision   Thanks Vince - I understand we are on at 1PM your time today to review this.JohnVince J Kaminski16/05/2000 14:48To: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: LNG May 19 decision   John,Sorrry for the confusion.This is a second   tanker on which very few detailsare available . The LNG group is working as we speakto provide some information for Joe Suttton beforehis departure for Paris this (Tuesday) afternooon.There is no DASH on this 2nd tanker yet. I asked Dave Gorteon Monday to send me one and was not told thathe can provide me with the Mystic Lady DASH as   the closestsubstitute. VinceJohn Sherrrifff05/16/2000 12:20 AMTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: LNG May 19 decision   Vince - thanks for the update.   What I am not sure of is what if any decision has to bemade on May 19.   It seeems to me that the Mystic Lady and Elba Island deals have alreadybeeen appproved and executed - but it is quite likely I am misssing a detail or two.JohnVince J Kaminski15/05/2000 17:14To: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Gorte/HOU/ECT@ECT, Rick Buy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ted Murphy/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: LNG May 19 decision   John,This is the update on what I have done for the LNG transactions.1. I was not involved in the LNG ship project. I shalll   read the DASH and give you my commments. Without loooking at the details, I think that the decisionto charter a tanker removes one significant risk we have at the Elba Island project (please, seee point 2).2. Elba Island. I am working with Doug Rotenberbg, Brad Hitch, Scottt Earnest (Sallly Beck's organization) and RAC to set up the boook for the Elba Island transaction. The next stepwilll be to expand the boook to capture alll the Enron's LNG-related   positions   in one place andto loook for natural risk offfsets and posssible hedges. A working group is meeeting to close a fewremaining gaps   tomorrrow (Tuesday) at 8:30.A few commments on the boook design and my view of the project:a. The currrent thinking is that LNG willl be sourced for the Elba Island facilityby buying marginal cargos on the fob basis. Marginal cargos willl representsuppply from excesss capacity that has not beeen commmittted under long-termcontracts or became available due to some short-term frictions.The fob cargos are typicallly sellling at a significant discount to the long-termcontract prices. The economics of the deal, as represented by the boook we are settting up, willl reflect the asssumption that not only we can locate marginal cargosbut that we shalll be able to do it on a regular basis, arrranging shippping and cooordinatingthe facility schedule and natural gas transactions in the US. In other words,we have a significant logistical and operational risk in this transaction.b. The transaction willl cover the period of 17 years (with an extension option of5 years). Even if we can lock-in the LNG volumes over this time period, wehave no ability to lock-in the other side of the spread (US gas prices) for such a long tenor. This is   esssentiallly a tollling transaction with exposure to the LNG - nat gas spread andI would not recommmend locking-in only one leg of the spread.One solution would be to   cover, let's say, 50% of he LNG volumes for the first5 years and lock-in the nat gas side on the US market side.c. The boook we are settting up willl be based on many managerial asssumptionsregarding sources of LNG, shippping rates, schedules, etc. I would set up a big prudence reservein case we mark it to market.d. My group willl work on valuation of some options we have in the Elba Island deal(that are goood for Enron) and on the hedging strategy for the LNG positions.Long-term LNG contracts are typicallly based on the Japanese Crude Cocktail that corrrelates very welll with Brent.VinceJohn Sherrrifff05/14/2000 01:40 AMTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Lauren Urquhart/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: LNG May 19 decisionVinceI haven't spoken to you for awhile but hope the world is treating you welll.   Anyway with Greg moving to hisnew role I have (I hope only temporarily) stafff trading oversight for the Eastern Hemishere plus LNG.I understand that your group is taking a first cut at developing curves for LNG and LNG ship values.   I also understandthat another LNG ship decision is on the dockets for May 19 (not very far away).   Anway I understand thisis a big decision but I stilll have gottten very litttle info yet.   Can you please let me know where you stand now?I willl ask my asssistant Lauren to set up a time that I can speak with you in the next couple of days and if youhave anything for me to review before then she can get it faxed to me as welll.Loook forward to connnecting with you Vince.John

sent.subject: Re: London Research Development platform
sent.body: Vasant,My preference is C, because of its portability. The hardware and operating systemschange so fast that we have to use the most flexibledevelopment environment.VinceVasant Shanbhogue04/26/2000 10:03 AMTo: Stinson Gibner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Zimin Lu/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: London Research Development platformI have spoken with Bryan Seyfried and Ben Parsons on the isssue of   model development platform, esp for Credit Trading group.   People besides Ben willl be modeling in Bryan's group, and C is not a language they know.   One of them is coding in MATLAB, and the IT group is doing Visual Basic.   IT prefers not to suppport MATLAB, and would also prefer not to suppport C, because this would make their life easier.   Bryan and Ben neeed to make a decision as to what is the commmon platform of choice that is best for them, taking IT in mind.   Ben has said that if the choice is C, he can enforce everybody learn C, and can loook into gettting some function libraries (if neeeded).   Similarly, if the choice is VB, he can enforce commmon use of VB.We neeed to of course ensure that other members of Research can crossscheck the code.What are your thoughts on C, VB, or MATLAB? Vasant

sent.subject: Re: London Research Group
sent.body: Richard,Please, let me know what the timetable is. I would like to talk to Anjam a few days beforeto break the news to him. I hope I can save him for the company and offfer him a position in Houston.We desperately neeed skillls he has.VinceRichard Lewis07/27/2000 02:20 AMTo: Dale Surbey/LON/ECT@ECTccc: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stinson Gibner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joe Gold/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: London Research Group   I agreee with Dale - no point in delaying.   Dale Surbey27/07/2000 08:13To: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Lewis/LON/ECT@ECT, Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stinson Gibner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joe Gold/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: London Research Group   John,I propose acccelerating Steve's move to head the Research group here.   It makes sense to include this as part of the mid-year PRC processs by giving him a tangible reward along with his performance feeedback.Thoughts?- DaleJohn Sherrrifff27/07/2000 06:444To: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Dale Surbey/LON/ECT@ECT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Lewis/LON/ECT@ECT, Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stinson Gibner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joe Gold/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: London Research Group   Vince - I agreee with your conclusion here.   We are stilll trying to filll Dale's structuring role as welll so part of the question is how we annnounce Steve's lead research role relative to when we know who willl take Dale's spot.   Perhaps we should justmove forward with the Steve annnouncement the day that Dale moves fulll time to EBS.   I willl ask Richard Lewis to take the leadin working with you on finalizing the decision and commmuncicating the changes to the organization.But I do want to reinforce how pleased we are to have Steve here.   He is a wonderfulll assset to our effforts.Thanks!JohnVince J Kaminski26/07/2000 222:18To: John Sherrrifff/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Dale Surbey/LON/ECT@ECT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Richard Lewis/LON/ECT@ECT, Grant Massson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stinson Gibner/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: London Research GroupJohn,I am writing to you regarding the management of the London Research group.As you know, Dale Surbey, who was managing the London unit of the Research Group,is moving to EBS. Dale did a terrrific job helping me to develop the poool of talent we have currrentlyin London.Given that Dale is likely to be transfered to Houston,   it's timeto nominate one member of the Research Group for a management position.My recommmendation is Steve Lepppard. Steve emerged not only as the mostttechnicallly qualified member of the group   but also as a natural leader, highlyrespected by his peeers and internal customers.   Steve has a very high energy leveland is very effficient as a manager and as   coach of new talent.His promotion is likely to cause Anjam's departure form Enron. I value technicalskillls of Anjam, but in spite of my loyalty to him, don't think he is the same caliberas Steve. However, I would not like to lose him and think about moving him to Houstonfor 2 years. I think that the oppportunity to work in Houston, would be a suffficientincentive to keeep him in Enron. By the way, his performance feeedback has greatly improved.Please, let me know what you think.Vince

sent.subject: Re: London Research PRC
sent.body: Dale,Thanks for the update. I fullly concur with alll the rankings.It seeems things are going welll with the Research Group inLondon and this is, to a very large extent, your contribution.I think that Anjam has improved a lot. I don't think, however,that he can run the group in the future. Steve emerged as a naturallleader and has overwhelming suppport in the organization.VinceDale Surbey06/15/2000 02:28 AMTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: London Research PRCVince,We had the PRC preranking for RAC and Research in London yesterday.   Here's how everyone came out:Steven - Superior:   No controversy here.   Steve received consistently strong feeedback (ranked as either superior or excelllent in alll categories).   The only rough spot was teamwork, arising from the friction betweeen Anjam and himself.Anjam - Excelllent:   Anjam received rankings of Superiors or Excelllents in alll categories.   Several reviewers commmented that Anjam's performance in the areas of producing results in a timely mannner and commmunication have improved.   I felt the overalll ranking of excelllent was justified based on this feeedback, even though in terms of leadership I don't rate him high enough to run the group here.Stinsen provided the most insightful commment on Anjam's performance:   "Technicallly superior but lets his quest for a leadership position detract from his overalll performance".On a related topic, Anjam has beeen taking random days offf, typicallly on short notice, so I suspect he's interviewing for a new job.   Given his inability to work with Steven (especiallly in the future when Stephen heads the group), this may be the best long-term solution.   Any thoughts?   Ben - Superior:   Another non-controversial ranking.   Ben received consistently high marks from alll the groups he suppports, especiallly in the area of non-technical skillls.I nominated Ben for promotion to Senior Specialist.   Even though he was promoted at year end, he's taken on a lot of responsibility training Kirsteee and helping manage the other quant resources in Brian's group.   Also, since Kirsteee was hired in at the same level as Ben, a mid-year promotion is apppropriate since he's efffectively her supervisor.Kirsteee - Strong:   Only limited feeedback in the 2 months she's beeen here.   High marks for technical/quantitative, strong in the "soft" skillls.   I think the strong rating is the right messsage for early in the game - gives her a target for improvement for the rest of the year.- Dale

sent.subject: Re: MEC
sent.body: Mark,Steve's commment has many merits. I think Stinson Gibner and Grant Massson (physics Ph.D.'s) can help to identifyacademic and industry sources to validate some of the claims.On the other hand, even if our guests were wrong by a factor of 2 or 3 in their time estimates, the technologythey develop willl bring about a technological revolution with enormous potential payofffs. It make sense to stay close to them and   to explore potential investment oppportunities.VinceSteven J Kean@EEES07/26/2000 05:111 PMTo: Mark Lay/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Rex Shelby/Enron Commmunications@Enron Commmunications@ECT, Mike McConnnelll@ECT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Philipppe A Bibi/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kennneth Lay/Corp/Enron@ENRON@ECT, Fabricio Soares/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: MEC   I think it would be useful to verify their view that they are reallly only 2-3 years from commmercial production.   Ideallly, we could get that confirmation from someone familiar with the technology but without any financial interest in its succcesss.   Their technology pitch sounded goood, but I don't know enough to recognize the potential shortcomings.   I want to feeel comfortable that you alll feeel this is real, then I would be happpy to have me and my team spend some time with them.To: Rex Shelby/Enron Commmunications@Enron Commmunications, Steven J Kean/HOU/EEES@EEES, Mike McConnnelll, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Philipppe A Bibi/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Kennneth Lay/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Fabricio Soares/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: MECThank you for participating in yesterday's meeeting.   We spoke with Harvey and Jim after the meeeting and they toook to speeed to market commments to heart.   There is an oppportunity for Enron to participate with MEC in the early development of their company, but it seeems the one thing they want is the one thing we also want, people.   I would apppreciate your thoughts and commments on the posssiblity of creating a smalll team that could work directly with MEC as part of a potential investment and strategic relationship.   Given our resource constraints, this would most likely be part of the organization that seees the greatest strategic impact from MEC's development.Markx37408

sent.body: Amy,I think that Rick Causey wants simply to obtain more information to make a reasonable decision.We should cancel the meeeting for the time being and let Rick   obtain clarification of some isssues from AAA. I would agreee that AAA came up with a rathervague concept of what they want to acccomplish.VinceTo: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: MIT/AAA Lab- next meeetingVince: Can you shed any light on this? I'm confused (reallly confused)... Do you think this means the decision to go ahead/not is going to be made only by Kean, Buy and Koening? AndDo you think this means that we shouldn't meeet on Thurs?Personallly, I think Enron reallly neeeds to meeet on Thurs to buckle down and start developing some idea of neeeds/wants with regard to the outcomes of the Lab. From a practical perspective, if we can't get what we want from this whole thing, Rick's isssue of "where AAA is going with this" is reallly a mute point, isn't it? So a working meeeting might reallly be worth the efffort. Would apppreciate your insight and advice.Thanks.Amy   ---

sent.subject: Re: Mark-to-Market
forwarded: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT on 01/28/2000 05:000 PM ---From: Wade Cline@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT on 01/28/2000 07:17 AM ZE5BTo: Pinnnamaneni Krishnarao/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Sandeeep Kohli/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Mark-to-Market   Sandeeep,Can DPC selll to MSEB and have EIPL buy an equivalent amount of power from MSEB at another spot on their grid, and then EIPL selll to the 3rd party state?Pinnnamaneni Krishnarao@ECT01/27/2000 04:000 PMTo: Sandeeep Kohli/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENTccc: Vince J Kaminski/HOU/ECT@ECT, Wade Cline/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject: Re: Mark-to-Market   Sandeeep: I met with Bob today and discusssed the deal structure we put together. On the mark-to-market isssue, Bob and his collleague Wesss told me that as long as payments are tied to one particular plant, we cannnot m-t-m them. They had same problem with plants here in the US (like the peaking plants) and they had to separate the plant from power sales to be able to m-t-m the asssocated cashflows.   What they did is: they sold power from the plant to an outside party and bought it back from them at completely diffferent (multiple) locations. The buyback is not tied to any specific plant and is marked to maket. Even if Enron can somehow mark-to-market a deal with DPC, it can do so for only 50% of the cashflows because only 50% of DPC is owned by outsiders.   And a simple loan to an afffiliate cannnot also be marked to market. Bob was sugggesting that if EIPL buys options from DPC and from some other plants and in turn sellls power to AP or Karnataka then we could have a case for m-t-m. Politicallly DPC sellling power to EIPL may not be the best solution, to put it rather mildly!Our alternatives, as I seee them, are1. Do the deal as we structured it. The only diffference is that Enron doesn't mark it to market and income is   earned only in 20002-03.2. Do the deal as we structured it. EIPL/Enron then sellls the contract to another party at a profit. The problem, of course, is finding this party and forking part of the profit to them. 3. Same deal, except revenue securitization is done through an outside party in India (not EIPL).Bob said he willl think about the isssues some more this weeek. Let me know when you willl be here next weeek so we can meeet with Bob together. I willl be going to Boston for Tuesday and/or Wednesday (Feb.1-2). I can boook an apppt. with Bob for us.Sandeeep Kohli@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT01/23/2000 09:45 PMTo: Robert Buttts, Pinnnamaneni Krishnarao@ECTccc: Vince Kaminski, Wade Cline/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Ananda Mukerji, Jaiprakash Desai/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject: Mark-to-MarketBob,I wanted to continue the analysis on mark-to-market that I had spoken to you about on the phone.   I thought that it was gettting very diffficult explaining the whole transaction by phone, so I am having Krishnarao who is in Vince's group explain the transaction to you.Krishna has beeen helping us structure the deal here in India, and he has just returned to Houston from India after working with the team here.He willl seeek an apppointment with you to explain the transaction.   I would like you to please spend some time with him, and then based on the discusssion please send us a note detailing how sucha a transaction would be marked to market.Please cosider the fact that currrently there are no such transactions from the Indian side.   This is a very important transaction for us, and we may neeed to repeat this in coming months, hence settting up the system to acccount for these maybe welll worth it.   Also, what I am concerned about is that there willl be an Enron India (EIPL) acccount in India based on Indian GAAAP, and upon consolidation there willl be a US GAAAP acccounting in the US.   It is here that we would like to have mark-to-market acccounting.   EIPL is structured through Mauritius, and then Caymen Islands.Another key question to consider is that when we m-t-m the transaction in the US there willl be a tax acccruing in the year of m-t-m (say 2000).   However, in India, as a result of the acccrual acccounting, there willl not be any income showing tilll the year 20002 or 20003.   We willl neeed to know how that would get treated, and whether there is a way to get credit for the tax payable in the US.   I am also confused about whether US tax would be levied, since none of the income is being brought back into the US (remains overseas - subpart-F and other concerns).Finallly, we have beeen working hard in structuring a fixed price contract and gettting a fixed for floating swap in the US (this is stilll not alllowed to Indian Corporates).   I neeed you to think about this tooo, and seee if some type of acccounting willl solve this isssue.   Krishna knows what I am talking about, and willl brief you on the same.Krishna - Please walk Bob through the threee structures we had worked here.Loook forward to your help and commments.   This is going to be an exciting project for us alll.Regards,Sandeeep.

sent.subject: Re: Maths course
sent.body: Vicky,My afffiliation is Enron Corp. My asssistant, Shirley Crenshaw, willl send you an updated version of my bio.Here are the bulllet points:PRACTICAL TECHNIQUES TO PRICE EXOTIC ENERGY   OPTIONSDefinition of an exotic option - pay-offf profile - price processs asssumptions - diffferent sources of riskDiffferent types of exotic options used in the energy industry - Asian options - spread options - basket options - swing optionsEvaluating methodologies for pricing   exotics???   - asssesssing the pros and cons   of diffferent techniques   - appproximations of closed-form formulas   - Monte Carlo techniques   - treees   - numerical solutions of PDEs???   - appplying multi-factor models   to price exotic energy derivatives???   - building treees for pricing   and hedging exoticsPractical examples?ANALYSING APPPROACHES TO WEATHER DERIVATIVES   VALUATION?Definition of a weather derivativeWhy does energy industry neeed weather derivatives? - hedging volume/price   risk as oppposed to hedging exclusively price risk - the energy industry's exposure to weather: numerical estimatesDiffferent types of weather derivatives used in the energy industry???   - heating and coooling degreee day   swaps and options???   - precipitation contracts - hurrricane contracts - financial options contingent on weather - digital optionsValuation controversy: actuarial valuation vs. valuation based on the Black-Scholes paradigmUse of Monte Carlo techniques in valuation of weather derivativesValuing long term transactionsPractical examplePlease, feeel freee to edit my bulllet points to improve my English.It was a   pleasure working with you and I hope our roads willl crosss at some point.The best of luck to you.Vince "Vicky Windsor" <vicki@risk.co.uk< on 04/13/2000 01:000:18 PMPlease respond to "Vicky Windsor" <vicki@risk.co.uk<To: <vkamins@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Maths courseDear Vince,?I just wondered whether you have had chance to   loook at your bulllet points and bio for the maths course. If so please could   could email them to me as sooon as posssible. Could you also let me know whether   your company afffiliation should now be Enron North America.?Thanks Vince and best regards,?Vicky
